author: Saba Hamedy
title: J.K. Rowling teases next 'Fantastic Beasts' movie with one perfect tweet
text:
It only takes J.K. Rowling one tweet to stir buzz.
The Harry Potter author on Monday used the social media platform to tease the next Fantastic Beasts film.
Having a Beastly day... pic.twitter.com/xRGCC9gt3B
— J.K. Rowling (@jk_rowling) February 27, 2017
Yeah, it's not much to go off of.
SEE ALSO: This deleted 'Fantastic Beasts' scene reveals some magical new details
But even a page is enough magic for the muggles and no-majs out there.
The first film — Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them — debuted in November.
The spinoff was inspired by a Hogwarts textbook of the same name. It was written by Rowling and directed by David Yates, who also directed the final four films in the Potter franchise.
It starred Oscar winner Eddie Remayne as "magizoologist" Newt Scamander, Katherine Waterston (of Inherent Vice ) as a witch named Tina and Colin Farrell as a wizard named Graves.
On Sunday, the film picked up an Oscar for best costume design, which went to Colleen Atwood, marking the Potter universe's first Academy Award.
All we know for sure about the second installment is that Gellert Grindelwald, aka "the second most dangerous Dark Wizard of All Time," will definitely make an appearance .
The second installment is expected to roll out in theaters in November of 2018.
